meanings.definition: A person who seeks to profit from the spoils of war or political office.
meanings.sent1: The spoilsmen eagerly awaited their share of the treasure after the battle.
meanings.sent2: The spoilsmen divided the resources among themselves after the successful campaign.
meanings.sent3: The spoilsmen joked about who would get the biggest piece of the pie.
meanings.sent4: In the world of politics, spoilsmen are like vultures waiting to swoop in for their gain.
meanings.sent5: The image of spoilsmen scrambling for rewards is etched in history books.

meanings.sent1: The spoilsmen gathered together to discuss their next move.
meanings.sent2: We saw a group of spoilsmen celebrating their victory in the town square.
meanings.sent3: The spoilsmen in the room all wore matching hats for some reason.
meanings.sent4: The spoilsmen stood out in the crowd with their distinctive attire.
meanings.sent5: The presence of spoilsmen signaled a change in the political landscape.
